name: Knuckle Duckle
desc:
A kuuvahki mechanism of peculiar make, made from scrap metal and mechanical bearings, that bears a partial resemblance — as per its creator's proclivities, apparently — to a "duck."
Its output and resistance to damage are comparable to the Fatui's most cutting-edge warfighting weaponry... But even so, it remains simply a toy duck that can punch its opponents very, very hard. A creator's preferences will always do much to determine a creation's appearance, as clay lacks the authority to question its creator's choice of molds. The world beneath the moon has long been sculpted into a form that people take for granted, but in the eyes of its original inhabitants, that form must surely be like a peculiar duck, shaped by its creator's bizarre predilections.
Of course, the blue-haired maid would never say any such thing to the mistress of the Krumkake Craftshop — after all, ducks are adorable, especially compared to the world's present aspect.

dropMaterial.name: Mora
dropMaterial.desc: Common currency. The one language everybody speaks.

dropMaterial.name: Companionship EXP
dropMaterial.desc: Companionship EXP. Used to increase Friendship levels.

dropMaterial.name: Precision Kuuvahki Stamping Die
dropMaterial.desc:
A stamping die taken from the wreckage of a defeated Knuckle Duckle — think of it as a keepsake from Aino.
A philosopher from Sumeru once argued that self-replication is a unique characteristic of life, an unparalleled achievement that no man-made object can mimic. The power to reproduce is the key that separates mankind from the divine.
However, if a machine is given an exact mold that it can use to replicate itself, mold included, then can not this too be considered perpetual self-replication? The former master of the silent, blue-haired maid who stands by Aino's side once pondered that same question but ultimately dismissed it out of fear that a perpetually self-replicating machine would consume everything on the planet's surface.
Such problems have never concerned Aino. This machine will not exhaust the world's resources to multiply itself just yet — after all, it's just a duck.

dropMaterial.name: Vajrada Amethyst Fragment
dropMaterial.desc:
Character Ascension material.
"This body is the noblest and most eminent of all in this world."

dropMaterial.name: Vajrada Amethyst Chunk
dropMaterial.desc:
Character Ascension material.
"This body is the noblest and most eminent of all in this world.
It should hold absolute control over this world."

dropMaterial.name: Vajrada Amethyst Gemstone
dropMaterial.desc:
Character Ascension material.
"This body is the noblest and most eminent of all in this world.
"It should hold absolute control over this world.
"It once promised its people a dream: the never-changing 'eternity.'"

customize.text:
A duck-shaped combat machine built from scrap metal and powered by kuuvahki. It is programmed with a variety of strategies.
Once combat progresses to a certain point, it will enter Duckstruction Mode, becoming more aggressive, generating a Ward for itself, and summoning floating Stamping Devices to harass you.
When this happens, you must first deal with the Stamping Devices. <color=#ffe14b>Deal DMG with Electro-Charged or Lunar-Charged reactions, or destroy them directly,</color> to fry their circuits and cause them to attack Knuckle Duckle's Ward instead...

<color=#ffffff>Wonders of the World</color>
<color=#ffd780>Arsenal Duck Hunt</color>
Destroy Knuckle Duckle's Ward by downing all of its Stamping Devices.

customize.name: Primogem
customize.desc: A primordial crystalline gem that's beyond the mundane world. Shines with the condensed hopes and dreams of universes that once were.

customize.text:
<color=#ffffff>Meetings in Outrealm: Series VI</color>
<color=#ffd780>Into the Breach!</color>
Defeat Knuckle Duckle in Co-Op Mode.
